title: `entries` does not work reliable in `+server.js` files

labels.name: ready to implement
labels.description: please submit PRs for these issues!

body:
### Describe the bug

The newly introduced [`entries`-export](https://kit.svelte.dev/docs/page-options#entries) are currently only documented for `+page.server.js` and `+page.js`, but I tried them also in a `+server.js` file and the export get's picked up, which is great.
But there are 2 issues:

1. tooling thinks that `entries` can't be exported in a `+server.js` file:
	![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/21335119/237050137-33558833-d0fd-447f-9417-7f3ac867088c.png)

2. the route parameter placeholder does not get replaced correctly:
	for the file `routes/lang/[language].json/+server.js` I need to return `{ language : 'en.json' }` and not just `{ language : 'en' }` (without `'.json'` at the end).
   This one is a general error with the `entries` implementation and does also affect `+page.server.js` and `+page.js`

At then end the documentation should also be updated to include a note that this feature also works for `+server.js` files

### Reproduction

1. create the file `routes/lang/[language].json/+server.js` and add the following code:
	```js
	import { json } from '@sveltejs/kit'
	
	export const prerender = true
	
	export const GET = ({ params: { language } }) => {
		return json({ language })
	}
	
	export const entries = async () => {
		return [
			{ language: 'en' },
			{ language: 'de' },
		]
	}
	```
2. the Svelte VS Code extension should show the error that `entries` is not a valid export
3. run `npm run build`
4. The build should fail because it tries to load `/lang/en` but that route does not exist
5. replace the `entries` export with
	```js
	export const entries = async () => {
		return [
			{ language: 'en.json' },
			{ language: 'de.json' },
		]
	}
	```
6. now the build will succeed

### Logs

_No response_

### System Info

```Shell
System:
    OS: Linux 5.15 Ubuntu 22.04.1 LTS 22.04.1 LTS (Jammy Jellyfish)
    CPU: (20) x64 12th Gen Intel(R) Core(TM) i7-12700H
    Memory: 4.71 GB / 15.47 GB
    Container: Yes
    Shell: 5.8.1 - /bin/zsh
  Binaries:
    Node: 18.16.0 - ~/.local/share/pnpm/node
    npm: 9.5.1 - ~/.local/share/pnpm/npm
  Browsers:
    Chrome: 109.0.5414.119
  npmPackages:
    @sveltejs/adapter-static: ^2.0.2 => 2.0.2 
    @sveltejs/kit: ^1.16.2 => 1.16.2 
    svelte: ^3.59.1 => 3.59.1 
    vite: 4.3.5 => 4.3.5
```


### Severity

serious, but I can work around it

### Additional Information

_No response_
